name: ICNA Chicago Illinois Organization
mission: Islamic Circle of North America (ICNA) is a non-ethnic, non-sectarian; open to all, independent, Islamic Organization. ICNA has project, programs, and a...
theoryOfChange: ICNA Chicago states that its projects, programs, and activities are designed to strengthen knowledge and character of individuals in order to build a strong community. ICNA Education describes a holistic approach of Islamic personality-development through mentorship and didactics, building a movement of students grounded in Islamic tradition and research methodology, and combining knowledge and activism to engage societal ills.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnachicago.org/donate (Source: https://icnachicago.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 31/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Icna Chicago Illinois Organization shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnachicago.org/donate (Source: https://icnachicago.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a 70.5% program expense ratio and holds 35.4 months of working capital.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides specific policies for zakat distribution.
Total revenue for the period was $1,206,252, supporting programs such as ICNA Education and Young Muslims.
Donors can contribute through various giving methods, including specific funds for different programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score reflecting solid financial efficiency and strong donor alignment, though it is tempered by low data confidence and a lack of external impact evaluations.
areas_for_improvement: Low data confidence due to limited third-party verification of program outcomes
Need for more detailed public reporting on specific impact metrics for educational programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: ICNA Chicago shows high alignment for Muslim donors by maintaining a clear zakat policy and addressing the urgent religious and cultural needs of the Chicago community [2][4]. The organization's non-sectarian and open-to-all mission further strengthens its fit for a broad donor base [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct provision model, allocating a 70.5% program expense ratio toward its educational and youth initiatives [1][3]. While financial health is robust with $1,206,252 in total revenue, the overall impact score is limited by a lack of cost-per-beneficiary data and low data confidence [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Icna Chicago Illinois Organization serves as a non-sectarian Islamic hub dedicated to community education and youth development through a diverse range of social programs.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.08 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 35.4 months of working capital
Clear zakat-eligibility and multiple donation channels for community support
baseline_narrative.summary: Operating as a non-ethnic and independent Islamic organization, ICNA Chicago focuses on educational initiatives and youth outreach through its Young Muslims (YM) program [1][3]. The organization is verified as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving methods [2][4].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score reflecting solid financial efficiency and strong donor alignment, though it is tempered by low data confidence and a lack of external impact evaluations.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="1">35.4 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, which may indicate underutilization of funds for mission delivery.
There is a need for more detailed public reporting on specific impact metrics for educational programs.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains strong financial health and efficiency.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the excessive working capital of <cite id="1">35.4 months of working capital</cite>, which suggests funds could be deployed more actively.

confidence.notes: Low data confidence due to limited third-party verification.

rich_narrative.headline: Icna Chicago Illinois Organization serves as a non-sectarian Islamic hub dedicated to community education and youth development through a diverse range of social programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support local Islamic educational initiatives and youth development programs in the Chicago area.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations locally
Care deeply about Islamic education and youth development
giving_considerations: Organization holds significant reserves relative to annual expenses
Limited public data on specific program outcomes
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who require rigorous academic evidence of effectiveness

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C means some outcome measurement but no rigorous evaluation.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Provides educational initiatives and youth outreach to foster community development.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has significant reserves but continues to expand its programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its focus on youth development through the Young Muslims program.

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="1">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating cost-effective resource mobilization.
ICNA Chicago maintains <cite id="1">35.4 months of working capital</cite> in working capital.
The organization is <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, providing multiple donation channels for community support.

strengths_deep_dive: ICNA Chicago demonstrates strong financial health with <cite id="3">$1,206,252 in total revenue</cite> and a <cite id="3">70.5% program expense ratio</cite>. The organization's fundraising efforts are highly efficient, costing just <cite id="1">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite>. Additionally, the charity maintains a robust liquidity position with <cite id="1">35.4 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, ensuring long-term stability.
rich_narrative.summary: Operating as a non-ethnic and independent Islamic organization, ICNA Chicago focuses on educational initiatives and youth outreach through its Young Muslims (YM) program. The organization reported <cite id="3">$1,206,252 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. ICNA Chicago is verified as <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations. The charity demonstrates high fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite>.
